metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7115 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Buffer overflow in the handle_packet function in mactelnet.c in the client in MAC-Telnet 0.4.3 and earlier allows remote TELNET servers to execute arbitrary code via a long string in an MT_CPTYPE_PASSSALT control packet. It was discovered that mactelnet mishandled certain input. If a victim were tricked into connecting to a malicious telnet server, a remote, unauthenticated attacker could execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: mactelnet: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
